Article.Abstract: Plasmodium falciparum MSP6 is a merozoite surface antigen that shows organization and sequence homologies similar to those of MSP3. Within its C-terminus conserved region, it presents some epitopes that are cross-reactive with MSP3 and others that are not, both being targets of naturally occurring antibodies that block the P. falciparum erythrocytic cycle in cooperation with monocytes.
Article.ArticleTitle: Plasmodium falciparum merozoite surface protein 6 displays multiple targets for naturally occurring antibodies that mediate monocyte-dependent parasite killing.
Article.Affiliations: Bio-medical Parasitology Unit, Institute Pasteur, 28 rue du Dr Roux, 75015 Paris, France.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Antibodies;Antigens, Protozoan;Epitopes;Membrane Proteins;Protozoan Proteins;merozoite surface protein 3, Plasmodium;merozoite surface protein 6, Plasmodium
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Animals; Antibodies(immunology); Antigens, Protozoan(immunology); Epitopes(immunology); Humans; Malaria, Falciparum(immunology); Membrane Proteins(immunology); Molecular Sequence Data; Monocytes(immunology); Plasmodium falciparum(immunology); Protozoan Proteins(immunology)

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Sera were collected from 30 malaria-protected African adults from the Ivory Coast.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Epitope-specific, affinity-purified antibodies were shown to inhibit parasitemia by ADCI assay. These same antibodies were also reactive with acetone-fixed asexual blood stage parasites by IFA.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Sera were collected from 30 malaria-protected African adults from the Ivory Coast.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from malaria-protected subjects recognized the epitope. The majority of the response was characterized by the IgG1 and IgG3 subclasses, but IgG2 and IgG4 were also found to bind, though at lower levels. Antibodies affinity purified using the peptide bound only to the epitope and showed no cross-reactivity to adjacent regions.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Sera were collected from 30 malaria-protected African adults from the Ivory Coast.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: MSP6 epitope-specific, affinity purified antibodies showed cross-reactivity with the MSP3 epitope.
